intro: Chazaliella subcordatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf chazaliella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Chazaliella subcordatifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
